alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 4:22PM MDT until August 23 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Grand County in north central Colorado... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Far eastern portions of East Troublesome Burn, near Grand Lake. This includes the following additional locations... Rocky Mountain National Park west entrance, Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd and Lower Stillwater Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
